bug.short_desc: Add ISO8601 parsing support to qx.land.normalize.Date

long_desc.thetext:
In our projects we are using ISO-8601 dates extensively. We have created a small bootstrap class to enhance the Date class with ISO features.
Since JavaScript 1.8.5 added support in Date.parse() for ISO date parsing,
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/parse
we propose including code from (for example)
https://github.com/csnover/js-iso8601/blob/master/iso8601.js
into qx.lang.normalize.Date
We kindly ask Qooxdoo developers to weigh the cost of adding more code to the core framework against the benefits of having said functionality available at all times, and decide if the enhancement proposal is worth considering.
Thanks for the report. I think it worth adding but can't give you a date when it will be added.
Thank you, there is no urgency at all. We will remove our code in favor of yours whenever it is released.
